item.title: $ echo "Hello, ${USER}!"
item.description:
Hi. I’m b1101

echo "I am a `OneOf=('musician' 'programmer'); echo $OneOf[$(( $RANDOM % 2 + 1 ))]`"
# Still have not decided completely

By the way, ‘b’ stands for flat and if you don’t know how much ‘1101’ is, you should probably ^D. All of this nicely sums up to this flattened, which is the sound

$ whoami

My name is Roman(like the Empire). No, you don’t need the ’s’ at the end.

My editor of choice is Neovim. I really like modal editing, but I am planning to try Emacs, I just want to get my Preonic before doing that.(Can’t wait to put all of of these modifier keys on the bottom row…). By the way, currently I use Pok3r from Vortex.

Sidenote: GNU guys are really serious about that ‘fancy’ website design, just look at Emacs page! I think any real user of Emacs would prefer a simple page with release notes and a link to a tarball instead of that useless bloat, people in need of install instructions are not capable of making use of it anyway

Currently I run Arch(I need Node, for example, which does not support LibreSSL and plus Arch just works) and Gentoo(my main, with LibreSSL). If you want to know more just go to my dotfile repo.

IRL

I have 2 bikes, both are built by myself. I like riding fast, and I am very happy that I can safely do it here, in Netherlands, where I am studying right now. I would probably be dead by now if I rode like that in the country I am originally from.

By the way, I have found a perfect pair of SPD shoes that I can wear casually and do not look as a total weirdo, yay!

One of the other things I like are board games. My favorite is Cosmic Encounter. Unfortunately, I am coding too much and do not have time to play them(or, actually, do anything else besides coding).

Surprising fact, I like to cook. I also do know how to bake cakes, for example, but I rarely do so as I have quit added sugar, flour and starchy stuff quite some time ago.

If you know me in real life, you probably think I am weird. Good to know.
